Summary Heading: I always stay here when I'm in the area
Summary: It is close to Knott's Berry Farm and Disney as well as to Fullerton and Brea. Honestly, it's convenient to both business and recreation.  There is a Marie Callendar a block away.  On Beach Blvd, there is a Claim Jumper, Black Angus, the Pirates Dinner Show, and more.

Summary Heading: So close to a 5 but still a great LA area Inn
Summary: So much more reasonable than staying in LA, yet accessible to everything and being on Centerpointe drive it has some privacy feel to it. Stayed on top floor 2 room suite, nice room though they have other suite's wherein the bathroom is not in the bedroom but in a hall, like that set up better so anyone up early or sleeping on the sofa (kids maybe) could use the bathroom without waking the other guest.  Regardless, decent pricing, they probably should have the slow and shaky elevators checked out. Furniture in the suite room is nice and clean but not the most comfortable for long enjoyment. On this occasion hotel was very busy due to holiday events and Rose Bowl Parade participant band from Japan staying over for New Years.

Stayed here because of proximity to fa.turn.  Bathroom outdated, and tub area not particulary clean.  Very cheap toiletries.  Guests are allowed to bring hot plates and cook in their rooms.  Did not appreciate the smell of curry permeating my room
Manager Response: Dear Annecar0ls, Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us in Buena Park. I do apologize that the bathroom in your room was not up to standards. We do use comments such as yours to ensure we continue to deliver a great product. I certainly hope if your back in the area that you will give us another chance at being the hotel of your choice.

Summary: Clean room and comfortable beds.  Quiet rooms...couldn't really hear much out in hall or in rooms which was great.  There were some noisy kids out in halls and next door and while I was in the room I never heard them.

I stayed at this hotel because of a dog competition nearby. The staff was friendly and helpful. there is plenty of dog potty areas.   The rooms are spacious and have ample room for dog kennels as well as all my other travel needs.

My wife and I were in Southern California for the Rose Parade and to see some of the sights in the LA area.  I picked this hotel because it was  just far enough away from LA to bring the cost of hotel rooms down, but close enough to not spend a lot of time on the freeways.  It is also very convenient if you want to go to Knott's Berry Farm or Disneyland.  This hotel is located in a business park which made it very quiet as compared to one located next to a freeway.  Unfortunately, the breakfast bar didn't include any sugar free syrup so I went out for breakfast which was easy because there are a variety of choices available.  If you are going to travel into LA from this location I advise taking Orangethorpe Ave. east to I-5 and going north rather than jumping of 91 at the hotel.

Overall, it was a very pleasant stay. Property is close to Knotts, a mall with a large theater complex and a variety of places to eat from fast to nicer places - McDonalds, Habit, Starbucks. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff we encountered we all very friendly. The only thing slightly lacking is the variety of the breakfast. Although the waffles were very good, they were the only hot item offered - no eggs, bacon, hash browns, etc - that we have had at other La Quinta properties. The breakfast isn't the only reason I stay at La Quinta but that takes my "Excellent" rating down to "Very Good".

The first room given to us smelled so bad of smoke that we had to change rooms right away. We then got to the new room to find that the bathtub was really dirty. Also we had the room smell of fire when we turned on the heater. We turned it off and when we returned later last night the room was freezing and the heater would not work. We were unable to sleep because the room was super cold. Hotel staff were not friendly. When we checked out the hotel staff did not ask us how our stay was or tell us thank you for staying there or anything. Poor experience.
Manager Response: Dear maryy2116, I am very sorry to hear that your heater didn't work the way it should have during your stay with us. We have checked the unit and made the necessary repairs. Thank you for the feedback.

Summary: I thought the price for the hotel was great for Christmas. Remember you get what you pay for. The bathtub needed refacing, the shower curtain was dirty and the sink was slow draining. Basically, poor house keeping.   Also, not the most friendless staff!
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay. Your comments have been shared with our housekeeping staff to ensure that proper cleaning of the rooms is completed daily.

Summary: Have returned to this hotel multiple times and have enjoyed each and every stay.  The weather and location makes this hotel a unique stay.  Even though it costs a little bit above average, it is worth the expense.

We enjoyed our one night stay. Our room was spacious and clean. I really liked the large desk and having a microwave and refrigerator in the room.   Breakfast was typical, adequate business hotel fare. Dining room was clean. Public areas were nicely decorated for the holidays.

Summary Heading: No dogs or bus loads - this time.
Summary: This time - No dog barking in lobby or rooms nor bus loads of rude, loud and ill-mannered foreigners - thank goodness.  However, a few electrical plugs and USB connectors were unworkable.  Loud bathroom fan.  Short on face cloths.   Very late afternoon and early room service.   Still, a decent value and close to major highways.

Well maintained with clean rooms. It is a convenient  location and there is a good choose of restaurants in the area.The staff is friendly and helpful. I usually stay here once and month and enjoy my stays.

Summary Heading: Little problems here and there but nothing big
Summary: Don't let the title fool you, it was just over the barking dogs which can be rectified by putting them in the same area spread out. This is a great hotel especially or the price not to mention the food locations across the street. My family and j stay here whenever we come into town which is 2-3 times a month.

LaQuinta hotels are where we stay because are dogs travel with us always . .. .it is a piece of mind to have them with us and not worry about if they are being cared for properly - or how i would take care of them :-).  Over all the staff are very courteous, helpful and always pleasant. The hotels are comfortable, clean and reasonably priced.  Thk u we will stay again, again again etc.

This hotel is conveniently located in the middle of the LA-Orange County area with easy freeway access and plenty of places to eat in the area.  Very nice facility and very pleasant staff.  Everything I count on in a La Quinta Inn & Suites.

Summary Heading: Best Hotel in Buena Park for Price !!
Summary: I Love this Hotel as well as Staff and Managers ! They are Super Friendly ! The d√©cor is really cool compared to other La Quintas'. Tons of Restaurants in walking distance as well as some shopping. Maria and Sara were Awesome Breakfast attendants. Hard working ladies~ Manny and RJ were Most Helpful with my directions. I had trouble with opening my door. Denny in Maintenance assisted me with a smile and I was in. I was doing it wrong :) Sam ( Assistant GM) is Genuine in making sure my family enjoyed there stay. I LOVE this Place ! What more can I say ~

Summary Heading: Bugs in room and limited Breakfast choices
Summary: We've stayed at La Quinta properties in several states and have achieved elite status.  LQ is the first stop when searching for a hotel, mainly due to our corporate rate.  This property was priced competitively and in close proximity to Disneyland.  We booked for our three day stay.  On night two my daughter found a bug crawling on her leg.  After further inspection we found several other small roaches on the carpeting.  We notified the front desk and he said they were completely full.  Another more senior staff member was asked about another room.  We were told there was one room but the a/c didn't work.  Since it wasn't at hot we opted for poor circulation rather than bugs.  There carpeting was also dirty and debris was observed at the base of the bed.    Finally the "bright
Manager Response: Thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. I apologize for the problems you encountered during your stay with us. We have an outside company treat our rooms monthly to prevent any type of infestation of insects. I have ensured that the room in question will be treated on their next visit. If your travels bring you back to the Buena Park area I hope that La Quinta will continue to be your hotel of choice.

Summary: Average rating. Arrived earlier and got a room after being turned down first.  Restroom in room 222 had "closet' type doors with no locks! Only one snack received for our Elite status.  Had to ask for early room text.  Friday morning clerk was rather rude after requesting king bed for our additional room.  A little too pricey.  We've paid half the price for better accommodations.
Manager Response: Ransom K, thank you for your comments regarding your recent stay with us. We strive to meet all of our guest request and in your case with early check in we weren't able to accommodate you. Our Elite members do receive a water and cookie at check in, in your case an exception should have been made. Please accept my sincere apologies for these issues. I certainly hope that you will give us another chance when ever you return to the Buena Park area.

Summary: I like this hotel.  It is in a perfect location close to Knott's, Disney, and other sites.  It is clean and affordable with easy access to the freeway system.  The local restaurants are good as well.  Breakfast is fine.  I'm not that picky at breakfast anyway.

Overall not to bad, Check in was fast, rooms were descent but beds are very small for a tall guy with a family. Breakfast selection is minimal. If I had to would stay again, was close enough to the  amusement parks without breaking you.

This is one of our go-to hotels when doing Disneyland if the closer ones are booked up or are too expensive.  This LQ is usually pretty clean and comfy and is located close enough to places to eat and shop.  No real complaints for the hotel of this price range.  It's a good value for the money and gets the job done.  Breakfast is okay with the usual LQ waffles, yogurts, muffins, and cereal.  Elevators are kinda slow to start so don't freak out if on a full load it takes a few seconds to start moving.  Room bathrooms have non-locking double doors but the toilets have been upgraded to prevent clogs.  Shower water pressure is acceptable and the bedspreads are modernized and don't have the never-washed covers.  Flat screen TVs with Plug and Play capabilities: I used my Amazon Fire

LaQuinta is the hotel of choice for my mom to stay at when she is in town.  Overall it is a great place to stay, staff is very friendly, rooms clean and in wonderful condition, and breakfast selection is very good, love the waffle!

Summary Heading: Not a fund hotel to stay at.
Summary: If you do not like or need breakfast it is not a bad hotel to stay at. Also do not try to have an intelligent conversation with the desk staff.  as you will be called ignorant if you do not agree with their very limited idea of the country or world events.  And you better enjoy barking dogs as this is a Dog friendly hotel.
Manager Response: Dear Joseph W, please accept my sincere apologies for the issues you encountered during your recent stay with us. We are always looking for ways to improve the offerings on our complimentary breakfast bar. Unfortunately we fell short of your expectations this time. We do hope that you will give us another try on your next trip to our area.

Summary: This Hotel was comfortable,clean, great staff, good breakfast & a nice pool. Convenient to all major roads. A short drive to Disney World & other Theme Parks as well as the Ocean. Reasonably priced for what you get. Good restaurants within safe walking distance are only minutes away. Convenient to LAX airport.  If on business in the LA area this is a good place to call Headquarters for a few days or a week. I have stayed here a number of times and will continue to do so in the future.

hotel is great as well as your employees in all areas,, though I would like to recommend to have Refrigerators in all rooms sometimes I get a room without and it and just is not right very bad when cant have nothing cold handy and have to get ice very inconvenient

this is an exelent hote, staff is bery frenly, its close to the freeway and walking thistand restaurans, to me this la quinta is one of the best there are in los angeles, river side, temecula, and around the area

I just want to say that I truly hate walking into a hotel with an open mind and leaving with the worst taste in my mouth.  My check-in experience was wonderful, the front desk clerk Dave was a pleasure to meet.  The first thing I do upon checking into a room is checking out my room thoroughly before settling in.  During this process I found the bathroom to be not as clean as I would like it to be but was ok with it until I found hair in the tub.  Everyone knows finding hair anywhere is a clear sign of nastiness!  Anyway, I complained about it to the front desk on our way out to dinner.  Was told it was taken care of only to find that hair was still in the tub. Complained again and made it a point to let them know I would clean it myself but was not happy!  On my 2nd day stay, I

Wow!  This La Quinta was very clean and modern!  The rooms were comfortable, spacious and clean.  The staff was very organized, helpful and friendly.  They have a great variety for breakfast and I would recommend LQ Buena Park to all my friends as it is close to Disney.

great hotel, clean comfortable rooms. good breakfast. is close to knots berry farm and short 15 minute drive to disneyland. excellent value as an option to staying close to disneyland resort. we will be staying here again.

From the elevators to the overall condition of the rooms. Tub/Showers are worn out. Needs painting overall. the elevator has to be the slowest I have ever encountered. Make sure you park in the hotel parking lot and NOT in the other areas or you will asked to move by the security guard for the buildings around the area.

We have two small dogs, and must always find a place they are welcome.  Some hotels, aren't fit for dogs, let alone people.  This hotel is just right. It's classy, clean, updated and friendly.  We will be traveling to this area many times over the next few years. This will be our hotel of choice.

Located relatively close to major highways,  I was pleasantly surprised at the hotel.   It's fairly quiet and the entrance is modern and updated.  True the rooms could use an update on some items but the room was clean and the staff excellent and attentive. Eat at the nearby Italian restaurant and enjoy your stay!

Nice hotel for a pet friendly stay. Crappy coffee. Just a block and 1/2 half to Starbucks for good coffee. Breakfast is just ok. Staff is friendly. Rooms are clean . Close to the freeway for easy access to the area.

Hotel need new bathroom fixtures, they are old and are hard to keep clean. The hallways had a musky bar smell. The parking and restaurants near by are awesome. Elevators seem dirty and needed to redone or remodel

I had the pleasure of staying here for two weeks on business.  Very nice accommodations and the hotel staff was extremely pleasant.  There is no doubt in my mind that I would stay here again given another visit to Buena Park.

Summary Heading: Very average for a budget hotel
Summary: U pay budget, you get budget, and I guess that's OK.  Rooms clean, basic needs are met. Breakfast waffles and bagels with room temp OJ. That's it! Neighborhood safe.  Elevators pretty beat up on inside Small pool area.  Over all met our U pay budget, you get budget, and I guess that's OK.  Rooms clean, basic needs are met. Breakfast waffles and bagels with room temp OJ. That's it! Neighborhood safe.  Elevators pretty beat up on inside Small pool area

I recommend this clean appropriated located La Quinta Inn to future visitors. The only thing I would like to see is a shuttle service to nearby attractions. The was helpful and breakfast was appropriate for its value

We are here for the Pony Super Regional baseball tournament. An entire team of 14 year old boys and their families. Plus five other teams from around the country.  From the very first night, July 30, the hotel has been great.   The best service of all has been the Front Desk Associate, RJ.  He gets ****** stars! One family had issues with their check in, he fixed it. He has been great with advice on where to go eat, shop and the best beaches. RJ has gone out of his way to help all six baseball teams staying here having a blast. Rooms were clean and a tad small. Originally there were no refrigerators but RJ fixed that too. It's a great central location for anywhere in SoCal. Our team didn't win but with RJ's help it was a trip of a lifetime!

No complaints. Not to far from Disneyland. Right off the freeway. Lots a food places near by. Hotel and room were clean and the air conditioner worked great. Rates were good. Would definitely stay there again.

Stayed at the hotel for one night. Hallway carpets are dirty and stained. Bathroom smelled. There was water on carpet just outside bathroom. Breakfast area was small and crowded. Will not stay again. Check in was good and efficient.

Summary Heading: Experience at La QuintaOrange County Buena Park
Summary: mattress very bad condition dog barking excessive smelly carpet kids running up and down the hallway like a playground staff concentrating more in their personal phones manager on duty lied by telling us that our concern was going to be addressed

We chose this hotel because it was close to Disneyland but not too close. This was by far, the worst La Quinta I have stayed at. The hallway carpet was stained and not vacuumed. Our shower was DISGUSTING. There was mold on the ceiling, around the faucet and around the handle. The bathtub was so gross, we held our 16 month old while we showered so he wouldn't have to touch the tub with his bare feet. The toilet was even stained. My parents had a separate room where my mom found a live cockroach by her trash can. I will never stay at this hotel again. I'm not a picky person but this was so bad that we chose to cancel the last 3 days of our reservations and drove about 20 miles to find a different, cleaner hotel. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone, let alone people traveling

Our customer placed us at La Quinta as it was close to their company location.  When we checked in we were pleasantly surprised - lobby newly remodeled, everything looked fresh and clean.  The staff that checked us in was very nice and helpful. My room 616 was dingy and travel worn - the bathroom needed a thorough clean.  The carpet in the hallway and in front of the elevators was very dirty and unkept.  I went out to the pool area  - and again the tables were full of trash and dirty. After a long day of meetings - at 10:30 PM dogs started howling down the hall, I called the front desk and was told they could not locate the owners - and of course they could not move me to another location.  I was not as impressed with the evening person as the day personnel, which happens.

The property is well maintained, conveniently located near the freeway, surprisingly quiet. My dog thought the bed was comfortable. It is walking distance to a Starbucks as the coffee is horrible. There are several restaurants within walking distance .The staff was all friendly.

This hotel is nasty, there is trash all out in the parking lot, and the cement areas look like they have never been washed down.  The lobby area looks nice, but when you get off the elevator to go to your room the hallway area is nasty and in a bad need of a shampoo, the area where the coke and ice machine are, the floor is so nasty and dirty it makes you sick.  When we entered our room, it had a horrible smell, the clerk came up to spray the floor and just said well turn on the air and it will help the smell go away.  There was a dirty wash rag left behind our toilet - plus mold looking stuff in the tub, in the corners of the wall areas on the floors there was hair and particles of things that have not been swept in a while.  I took pictures of all of this and showed to the

La Quinta is a great place to stay when traveling with a group, no extra person charge. Free breakfast saves money.   Lots of good eating places close by and close to freeway on ramp. Great location.  Friendly staff

Summary Heading: Great hotel, dog friendly, good location and lots of places to eat
Summary: The location of the hotel is great.  Clean, modern, & dog friendly. Lots of different places to eat like Bulgogi House, Habit burger, and more.  Would stay here again.  Good value.  Easy access to freeway.  Breakfast was good.

Staff on Front desk had  Good sense of humor, Friendly, Quick check in and EXPRESS check out in morning and upon arrival.  Breakfast was neat, clean, very well displayed. Appealing to have ready for breakfast on the run.

Summary Heading: Start Your Day with a Good Breakfast
Summary: The hotel was run down since the last time we stayed here, which was in January.  My husband and his brother went down for coffee.  They came back and said that the breakfast was COLD  cereal, COLD boiled eggs!  We stayed at Holiday Inn-Fresno, the breakfast,

Summary Heading: Very nice stay... Courteous staff - Some ups and downs though.
Summary: Had not been back to CA for 16 years, and stayed here during my trip!  Needed a place near Knott's Berry Farm that took pets.  This place fit all my needs.  We arrived around noon, and they were nice enough to let us get a room early.  The staff was super nice.  We were on the 6th floor - which was inconvenient for me, but tolerable.   There is a great doggie area, and all the pets there were well-controlled - no problems for us.  The hotel had a laundry facility, which was a nice plus since we were on the road!!!!  The room was very clean - no problems there.  Some of the reviewers stated that the hotel looked dated.  I tend to disagree.  Our room was very nice, and appeared to be updated.    The breakfast was a problem though.  There was a lot to offer, but they ran out of

Great location, near but not directly, adjacent to noisy freeway.  Good value in seven-story modernized building.  However, have disturbing "animal friendly" policy, even for those that tolerate the four-legged furry friends elsewhere.  Appears to be no limit on number, size of dogs, nor cages required for same.  Barking in lobby? Tacky!

My family has an annual pass to Disneyland, and we visit several times a year.  We always staff at this La Quinta on our visits.  The staff are welcoming and professional.  The site is recently remodeled and well-maintained.  The atmosphere is always extremely quiet and soothing!

It was It was a great location and super easy to vet to had lots of great choices for places to eat !! Only thing lacking was the breakfast could have better choices and fresher things. Bagels had been frozen and thawed, butter was rock solid. Waffles were good and fast. Room was nice  Large gap between for and bottom of door had to put a towel on ground to cover the light coming in

This hotel is not one of  the nice and clean "La Quinta" hotels!.  The lobby is clean and nicely decorated, but the hotel itself is run down, in need of renovation.  Bathrooms are too small.  Beds are ok, but rooms are small and not extremely clean (hair on bathroom floor and in bathroom tub).  The worse was the small swimming pool.  Dirty towels left behind, beer cans, pizza boxes.  Will not return!

Very basic service hotel. There is nothing like service in this hotel.   But still the gentleman at reception was the best at his position.   The rooms are very basic, i found the bathroom layout very odd. the basin is outside the bathroom. So using basin will disturb your family ( by light or sound of water ). Bathrooms don't lock, there is literally no space in bathroom to change clothes.   Breakfast if complementary, saw for the first time that breakfast is served in disposable dishes, ( makes sense with the brand concept ).  Would make another choice of hotel with family

Hotel was ok for the price. Too many people partying late at night. Nearby restaurants. Renovations could've been better but still was pretty decent. Morning breakfast staff was a little slow and were rarely to be found. Would only stay here again if it was the only hotel available.

Grew up about 2 miles from here so nice to get back home and see the area and how it has changed. Hotel unfortunately is near the busy 91 frwy and the rooms were not insulated enough to deter the heavy freeway noise that occurs all hours of the night in OC area. Suggest bringing some ear plugs if you are a light sleeper. The style of this La Quinta is much different on the inside then others I have stayed in- a more contemporary modern clean lines look to the hotel lobby and the rooms. Bathroom set up was a bit odd with the toilet and shower separated from the sink that had double doors with no lock on it. Breakfast was busy but plenty of food and the usual Bright side items were present- waffles, hard bolied eggs, fruit pastries cereal juice etc

I love having an option when I go on a road trip with my four-legged babies. La Quinta takes away the guessing out of the equation, as I know my pets will be accepted, I will have a great and clean place to sleep and helpful staff, generally speaking. I loved the room I got this time, very clean, comfortable and it had the amenities I needed.

This area can be pricey because of near by attractions like Knott's and Disneyland, but this place is reasonable, especially for what you get.  Big bed, big TV great AC and free continental breakfast.  We stay here twice a year because of family near by.

Our stay was good except for the noise level.  Traffic noise outside and the walls are thin.  I didn't like hearing the man cussing next door at 10pm.  None of the soda machines were working but they did sell drinks and snacks downstairs so that was ok.  The room was an average room, nothing special and no fridge, but it was clean and the beds were comfy.  I would stay here again.

We had a great stay over Memorial Day Weekend.  We were here for a basketball tournament in Long Beach, which was less than 20 minutes away.  The stay was nice with the exception of the overly loud teenagers whose chaperones were nowhere to be found.  I dealt with that myself and they were accommodating kids.  Breakfast seemed to have something for everyone.  Bathroom areas were a little small for a family of 4, but we managed.  We missed having a fridge, but had brought a cooler, so our drinks stayed cold enough.  Nice ice machine on our floor. Pool was ok, nothing fancy, but perfect for the kids. Will definitely consider coming back here on our next visit to the area.

Summary Heading: Noisy and old in need of remodel
Summary: Staff is nice.  Location is perfect for me.  Interior of hotel is run down and old.  Needs and update.  Bathrooms are somewhat nasty.  Ventilation is poor.  DId not have breakfast, but it looked like the standard continental breakfast.

Fine suite room, one of the best of the La Quinta hotels we have stayed at.  General maintenance of building not adequate.  Carpets not vacuumed, wall paper peeling off wall, loose toilet seat, loose towel bar, cigarette butts on ground outside building.

Summary Heading: Nice hotel, nice location and nice people.
Summary: Although everything about the hotel was nice, it was not very good.  We were sent to three different rooms.  The first one, two queen beds.  The second one, already occupied.  The third one, just fine.  The rooms are just fine, nothing exceptional.  The breakfast is sub-par compared to other La Quintas.  Fine place to stay, just don't expect too much.

Summary Heading: La Quinta Suites @ La Palma, Calif.
Summary: Room was very comfortable, with in-room coffee, refrigerator, and microwave. Love that it is pet friendly. Food selection was convenient and quality good. Close proximity to amusement parks and easy access to freeway.

I took a chance in booking this hotel and was really surprised at how comfy and stylish the suite was.  Another few pluses are it's indoor pool and jacuzzi, it's  location... less than 1/2 mile from Disneyland, and a shuttle ($2) to take you there! I recommend La Quinta Inn & Suites, and will book here again on my next visit to Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Nice stay at a nice price!
Summary: We had a nice stay here at the La Quinta, clean and neat. Smelled great and close to a lot of nice resturants. Right near the freeway which made it easy to get to where we needed to get to. My only somewhat bad thing to say about our stay would be breakfast, the la quintas i usually stay at offer scrambled eggs, sasuage and gravy. Other than that all was great.

We recently spent one night at the La Quinta in La Palma, which was our second visit to this hotel.  The location is convenient to everything and there lots of restaurants in the area. If you are traveling with a dog, there is a nice pet area in front and plenty of places to walk without being on a busy street.  We stayed in a room with a king bed, sofa, 2 chairs, desk, microwave and refrigerator.  The room was spacious, very clean and the bed was comfortable.  The breakfast was fine, but a little under what we are used to from a La Quinta.    On our last visit the common areas in the hotel were pretty dirty, but it was just fine this time.  Everything looked clean and well maintained.  This is a very busy hotel and I'm sure keeping things clean is a challenge.  The front desk

For those who want to visit Disneyland theme parks this is an excellent value option. The hotel is like 10 minutes driving to Disneyland and 40 minutes driving to Universal Studios. The hotel includes a breakfast, wich is good. I definitely recommend it and would stay again at this hotel chain.

Nice hotel overall, beds are a little small (full size). Nice breakfast area with fresh fruit, yogurt, coffee, cereals, bagels and 2 waffle makers that are all ways busy. Sarah and Danielle are great CS agents. family friendly hotel. A lot of restaurants and stores near by. Not too far from Disneyland or LA.

Summary Heading: La Quint Inns abd Suites, La Palma
Summary: Address is really La Palma. Close enough to Orange County and Long Beach attractions and allows one to avoid the much higher taxes associated to Disneyland and environs as well as avoid Los Angeles County taxes.

We wanted to stay close to Disneyland but not the higher price that you would have to pay for a good hotel that was clean and  not so busy.  Looked for  good reviews and this was it!! It only took 15mim to Disneyland and no charge  for parking your car which some hotel do even if you are staying there.

We often stay at LaQuinta Inn properties and are usually very happy. This hotel was the exception - I am blaming it on poor management.  We had issues in almost every area here. Desk staff talks on the phone while guests wait for help, maintenance staff did not come to fix the air unit or bring us TV remote (no remote in room and we had to wait over 24 hours for someone to finally find an extra one from the kitchen for us!), housekeeping didn't help with water on the carpet or remote, breakfast was "wanting" in food options and staff friendliness, pool was cold and hot tub too. The beds were only full size, not queens. No shuttles to local attractions.  Very disappointed!

Rooms were nice and clean. Location was great, 10 min. drive to Disneyland with plenty of restaurants within walking distance. An elevator went out during the weekend so we had to use the stairs upon checkout. Other than that we had a great stay.

Elevator is slow, bathroom is made out of a closet, ac doesn't work in half the units we booked. Dave was amazing at check in. How ever at check out it was less then nice, including the manager Sam who was demeaning. Breakfast bar was average and air conditing was so cold you didn't want to stay to eat.

We always had an excellent stay at the La Quinta in Buena Park & we still don't know what happened that took so long for us to get our room. It seemed that there were not enough employees tending to the rooms.

Went down to visit family.  Needed to take our small dog.  Was so glad to find a good and clean hotel to stay in.  Family friendly.  Nice breakfast bar.  No issues checking in late.  Was a very positive experience and plan to stay here again next time we visit our family.

Hotel was very good.  Reservation had no problems. Staff was pleasant. Room was nice and clean. Close to shopping and quite a few restaurants. I did not have any issues while staying at the hotel. I have stayed there before as it is close to where i do business and again great rooms for the price.

While a nice and clean hotel, breakfast offering compared to other chains was very basic and less than most others in this price range.  Convenient location to many restaurants within walking distance.  Elevators while not a huge concern were always slow.

I had a very pleasant stay at this La Quinta. The updated rooms were very nice and spacious. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I called the morning of my check in to see if there was any way I could check in early. I asked for Noon and was told there would be no problem. At 10:50am I got a text saying my room was ready, AWESOME! Also, pets stay FREE here! How great is that? The location is also great. Lots of restaurants walking distance so didn't have to worry about dinner. I would highly recommend this hotel.

The cleanliness, service and overall accommodations at this hotel are stellar. Beds are always comfortable. Housekeeping stays on top of service, is very conscientious. I can't speak to breakfast as I don't usually eat breakfast, but I do like having the option on the occasion that I might. The staff is very friendly and accommodating. Location convenient to freeways, restaurants, grocery & gas.

We've stayed at this particular La Quinta numerous times with no disappointments.  The rooms are quiet and spacious and the beds are comfortable.  Best of all, the hotel is pet friendly.  There is a very nice breakfast in the morning, although we're seldom up early enough to enjoy it.  After a long drive we're not anxious to rise and shine in the a.m.

Summary Heading: Generally a great hotel in a nice building design
Summary: Personally i really enjoyed the stay at this La Quinta, had a nice room on the top floor that was a two room suite. Had a nice view on a rainy day of the Centerpointe circle.   Hotel has a really great Panda Inn restaurant in walking distance as well.  The room was very nicely designed like an one bedroom apartment almost.   Comfortable bed and sofa, i like that the bathroom was outside the master... which had a really room feel and a big closet.     Only thing which i reported and hope they take care of is their was a leak from the rain coming into the bathroom through the ceiling AC vent and this appeared to be an ongoing problem judging by paint damage to the door and paint.  Reported this and really hope it gets fixed ... giving benefit of the doubt otherwise hotel would be

This was 5th or 6th stay here. It is fairly close to Knotts and Disneyland, so as good as La Quinta gets. Variety of restaurants nearby, and quick access off or on to the 91 freeway.   Wi Fi has improved over previous stays. The market is now well stocked verus previous stays

Summary Heading: Not the quality of La Quinta
Summary: The hotel lobby and breakfast area are nice.  The breakfast is good quality.  The room was substandard for La Quinta.  A couple of lights in the room did not work.  The bathroom was poor quality.  Old, stained ceiling.  Only had soap, no shampoo, conditioner, mouthwash, etc.  The bed was fine.  The TV was a new flat screen TV.  I think they have not finished remodeling the hotel.

The Rooms, Staff, Breakfast and Cleanliness were all Very Good at this LaQuinta. I definitely recommend the stay here. Very Close to Knott's Berry Farm Park, 5 Minutes, about 15-20 minutes from Disneyland and The Honda Center. (Home of the Anaheim Ducks, Kiss arena football, and concerts).  and 10-15 minutes from the Anaheim Angels baseball park. And 25-30 minutes from Los Angeles airport (LAX), and Burbank airport (BUR).  Lots to do. The pool area is small and not maintained to well at this hotel, so if you need a nice pool swimming or hanging area i would choose a different hotel. But that's makes it  quite. So there is a Plus to that minus there.

Stayed here for 1 night with my husband. We're able to get our upgrade for la quinta elite. Room was clean and basic. Breakfast in the morning was extremely over crowded so we just got some coffee an left. The waffle line was really long. Left an article of clothing and try as I might was not able to receive it back. I know I left it hanging but apparently it magically disappeared. Be careful with your belongings here. Near a couple of gas stations and food marts.

Summary Heading: Great Stay in Buena Park, Ca.
Summary: Great hotel, close to amenities and shopping. Knotts Berry Farm just down the street. You may not get your GPS to find the street. It is off Orangethorpe and Valley View. King room with desk,fridge and microwave was very comfortable stay. Hi speed wifi for free use. Thanks

La Quinta Inn Buena Park is a very nice Hotel and reasonably priced and close to everything in the area. We traveled to see family for Christmas and go to Disneyland. Two very nice young men at the front desk were wonderful and very helpful. Manny and RJ.

Summary Heading: Better than an average La Quinta
Summary: I think this was renovated reasonably recently, because it was nicer than I expected.  I was there for a meeting next door in the morning so I chose this hotel reluctantly (lower brand than I like even on solo business trips) but it surprised me a little.  It's not four star and I didn't care.  It was pretty good and also quiet.  Staff was great.

Nice and clean place to stay. It was very  easy to check in and out. Breakfast was great and a lot of choices for everyone. Staff was very friendly and answered all our questions.Overall it was a great stay and we encountered no problems at all.

We spent Christmas Eve at this immaculate hotel with our 2 dogs. The updated interior decorating, cleanliness, friendly staff, service, breakfast was commendable. Despite the numerous dogs staying in the hotel, the rooms were very quiet. We were very impressed and plan to stay at this hotel whenever we are in the area. This will be frequently since our son and his wife live in Whittier and we are new grandparents! Thank you La Quinta for providing excellent customer service for our stay during the hectic activities involved with spending Christmas eve and day with family in several Los Angeles locations. We appreciated the refuge and peacefulness during this time.

We stay at this hotel every year and get together with friends camping nearby. Close to to the beach, clean and great breakfast.excellent service.We go to the beach all day and relax at night. great for families!

We were very surprised by La Quinta! This hotel has very nice decor and must have recently been remodeled. I believe we were upgraded to a larger room so that we could have a pull-out sofa for our boys to sleep on... the room also had a full-size work-desk with extra power outlets. The bed was very comfortable, a ton of space in the room, and again the whole hotel was decorated very nicely. I couldn't believe we were in a La Quinta! I've previously worked for 5 star hotels and I don't think our rooms were better than this. We picked this hotel because of their generous pet policy & proximity to Knott's. We will definitely stay with this brand again (our first time) when travelling with our dog. The bathroom was very small and basic, but we were in town for the theme parks, not a

Great location near attractions, dining and access to roads... but animal-permitted policy and lack of noise enforcement;  diminishing cleaning policy after initial redecoration;  and caters to bus loads of foreign hordes.

This hotel was pretty decent for the money, you got free breakfast in the morning, hotel was pretty clean, staff was friendly... it's an older hotel so there is a slight musty smell in the hallways, and a little bit in the room, not bad though, but bring a room spray and it's fine... air conditioning in the room was nice, and was pretty comfortable.

Summary Heading: La Quinta Inn at La Palma California
Summary: La Quinta Inn in La Palma, California is an excellent place to stay if you are visiting this side of Los Angeles. It is very accessible to whatever Orange and Los Angeles County has to offer, e.g. Disneyland and the surrounding restaurants of different culture. It is "pet friendly" and a very suitable if you have a big family visiting out of town or even locally.

I used points, but I'm using other LQ to continue  my trip ( San DIego & go back to this one ). This Hotel is very nice, I stayed before 2 or 3 times. I believe this year the price is higher than the times before.

This La Quinta is definitely a great place to stay. My boyfriend and I loved this hotel because it was near so many food restaurants and near a lot of convenient stores as well. We stayed here this past weekend (11/14-17/14) for our little mini vacation. We wanted to be somewhere in between LA and Santa Ana, and this place was our jackpot.  Upon arrival, the lobby felt welcoming and clean. The lady at the front desk helped us out with a quick check-in. Inside the lobby was a small living area, breakfast area, and very clean restrooms. We stayed on the 4th floor. The room itself was cute and spacious. The bathroom was small, but it wasn't a problem. It included a microwave and small refrigerator. The king bed was exceptionally comfortable. It was big enough for the both of us to

I wouldn't make a special trip to this hotel.  Breakfast was boring, the buffet was not refilled adequately and cleanly, and there were no tea bags for tea drinkers.  The price was ok, but the room had a very low volume shower-hard to rinse shampoo from your hair.  Ok for a night or two, but I would not spend a week here.

Awesome hotel! Very clean and comfortable beds. Great lighting and has an 'at-home' feel to the rooms. I love the d√©cor and closet space. Mirrors were full length, so it was great to see how my outfit looked before going out the door. The 'black-out' drapes made my sleep heavenly-so well it was a struggle to get up and ready for check out! Great rate and worth every penny!

We stayed here one night while visiting my family.  The main reason we picked La Quinta was because not only do they allow small pets (although you could easily get by with a medium sized one I think), but they don't require a deposit or charge extra.  If you have pets, that makes the stay worth it right there.  In addition, the room was clean, the bed comfortable, a nice desk, couch (we stayed in a king), frig, coffee, and acceptable breakfast and the price was reasonable (especially since no extra charge for the dogs). They don't even ask you about the pets.  When next time we go down to visit, we will definitely stay there again.

Summary Heading: Some problem, but it's OK overall.
Summary: We had shower problem, which had never been happen in US hotels.(It's common in Europe). Remodeled in side the room, but some part of the room remained pretty old. We may not stay here unless shower condition is getting better.

We arrived about five in the evening assigned a room, went to room bathroom had hair all ober it and tub wasnt cleaned went downstairs asked for another room gentleman upgraded our room very nice great customer service . Hotel is seven stories and it appears like the housekeeping standards are very lax in thos facility not to the reason i always stay at la quinta due to a great bef and always clean. Very disappointed at this one it was my wifes sixth birthday and she was grossed out. Not a good stay. Have stayed here in the past and dont remember it ever being so lax in housekeeping allthe carpets had stuff on them in the halls etc

Excellent if you are goint to Disneyland parks. Just a 15 minute drive. No so close to Los Angeles though. Feasible but nor recommended. There are lots of dining options in the avenue in front of the hotel and a big shopping center. If you are going to research it, look for businesses in Cerritos, which is the next town just a couple of blocks from the hotel. Be aware that there are no eggs or bacon on breakfast. Wi-fi is excellent! (It is more of a business hotel) Parking is free! A rarity in the LA area!

We recently stayed at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. It was a little farther away from DL (about 20 min drive) but to be honest saving the $ was WELL worth it and the ride back was a nice break for the throbbing feet!. The front staff was always curteous and helpful, the room was clean and well kept. Pool is a little small but worked great for us and the hot tub is divine after a long day walking around Disney. Breakfast was pretty decent, eggs, cereal, juice, waffles, bagels. Would be nice if there was a little different rotation of choices but overall plenty for this family of 4 with picky eaters. I noticed there were some guests with animals staying here but you never would've known it had you not seen it! Was reassuring to see a night guard in the parking lot. Would

We used a discount travel site to make this reservation and were not disappointed.  The front desk was very friendly and helpful.  The pool was small, but adequate.  The room was clean and plenty roomy for 3 of us.  The only funky thing is that the bathroom door is not solid; it's a split door, more like a closet door, with a ball bearing tension closure at the top.  In the middle of the night, when I opened the door, the ball bearing fell out and caused quite a loud noise, awakening my roommates.  The breakfast room was crowded and warm, but there were several waffle-makers, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, cereals, yogurt, etc.  I would stay here again, and it was definitely a good value for what we paid.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay if you're going to Knotts Berry Farms
Summary: We had a great experience at this hotel. If you're going to Knotts Berry Farms this is a great hotel to stay at. It less than 10 minutes from the park and it's easy to get from the hotel to the park. The room was clean, quiet, and comfortable - exactly what you want in your hotel when you're on vacation. The air conditioner, television, and shower worked perfect. The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful and we had absolutely zero problems. I will definitely come back here. An for the hotels in this area its a great price.

Great chain to travel w/ pets.  Buena Park also had night security watching over the parking lot, which was a nice perk.  Wished this location had fridge in all rooms - my room did not have a fridge and the ice machine was extremely slow.  Housekeeping only provided 1 bar of soap, so we had to bring the soap from the sink to the bathroom when we wanted to shower.  Since we arrived really late and was gone most of the next day, we did not report this problem.  My kids always like the waffle breakfast and having a place to swim.

We found the hotel to be clean, convenient, checkin was easy after a super long day on an airplane. Love the device charging port on the desk in the room. Everything was fairly new, but I don't really care about that as long as it's clean and the room is stocked appropriately. Excellent, for the price.

Had to make a fast trip to Southern California and picked this property as i am generally very happy with the La Quinta properties.  This was a great property.  Would definitely stay here again.  Also, had easy access to the freeways.

I am a senior citizen, I was traveling alone and I felt totally safe.  The room was cleaned beautifully daily, the staff was cordial and efficient.  Never worrying about my safety or my personal possessions made my stay comfortable and carefree.

The location is near to a lot of restaurants, near to the freeway, parking is free and safe. There is always a security guard at the front door. Outside building looks beautiful and the main lobby. The room was just okay, the carpet in going to the room looks dirty, needs new carpet. The bathroom door, tub and shower looks old style, door repainted. The trashcan with no plastic lining, they only provide 2 bar soaps and 1 tiny shampoo and conditioner in one. They have good breakfast though, worth it. It was just ok for me. Loved only the location and their free breakfast.

Summary Heading: Beautiful at first glance, but THE BATHROOMS
Summary: We were thrilled with the hotel when we first arrived. The price was good. Everything looks modern and nicely furnished. But then we walked into the bathroom in our room. It was gross. First of all, the shutter-style doors didn't even lock. And they didn't stay closed very well. Around the top of the wall there was a layer of dust and cobwebs like they hadn't cleaned it in years. And the bathtub was yellow. I'm not sure if it was stained or dirty, but it was gross.

We recently spent one night at the La Quinta Inn & Suites in La Palma.  This is a fairly large hotel and sits off the main street so it was pretty quiet.  The front desk staff was excellent; very good customer service at this hotel.  There is plenty of parking and there are plenty of restaurants in the area.  There are no rooms on the 1st floor, but there is an elevator.    We had a king room with a desk, sitting area, microwave, and refrigerator.  We also had a small balcony.  The room was fairly large, nicely furnished, clean and the bed was comfortable.  Although the room was nice, clean and comfortable, I did not rate this hotel excellent because the common areas were not well maintained in my opinion.  The hallway carpet and the breakfast room carpet looked very dirty and

I love the prices, rooms are beautiful and can't beat the free continental breakfast I just wish they had a similar happy hour or bar. Would be great after a long day at work and being a way form home.

I thought i was going to enjoy my stay and when i got to my room it was HOT. I checked the air conditioner and it was on cool and on high. It was not cooling. This rook had NO view and all i saw was a roof with stuff all over it. ( No happy ) So on my way out to get something to eat i stopped at the desk to let them know and the lady stated well the maintenance person is leaving in half an hour.  And nothing.  I was very up set as it was hot in the room. Then this morning  i was in the hall and i had 2 dogs running straight at me scared me . If you have animals they should be on a leash. When checking out i was asked how was everything.  I stated i was very upset and what happened. All i was told oh i am so sorry... Hmmmmm Still paid 113.00 dollars for this room. never again.

perfect place to stay near Buena park lots of nearby restaurants and freeway access, try it you might agree, you are in the center of all the theme parks not far from long beach if you are going that way as well, shopping galore and so much to do but you are in the perfect place the WIFI was easy to use and the staff the most courteous I have seen, try the pool it will serve you well so Enjoy!

For being a first timer,they showed all the right reasons to come back again. Close to amusement parks and easy access to freeways.The staff was eager to provide us with additional towels and a very good explanation about ticket purchases for the amusement parks surrounding the area. Kids had a blast and are eagerly awaiting next years trip.

Hotel was ok,but there was no shampoo in the whole hotel,and nobody could give one! We had travelled all day and been on a beach and needed a good shower.  Call yourself a hotel?  The  breakfast room was extremely busy,could not get a seat for 15 minutes,and the breakfast  items were very limited. Our booking was a reward night,and our reward was a room facing the busy highway. I will not return

Finding a hotel that was pet-friendly (not ‚Äútolerant‚Äù) near Huntington Beach Dog Beach was the goal of the trip. This was the closest hotel, at a budget rate with no extra charges, no matter the size of the pet. We received a text from the hotel about noon notifying us that our room was ready. We were pleasantly surprised at the ease and short drive from the beach (19 minutes), and the decent location. When we arrived after 4:00, we were given a room on the 7th floor. The lobby is very clean and modern looking. Staff was pleasant during check in. Parking conveniently located on both sides of the lobby. Sliding doors were great for bringing in luggage and a Great Dane. When we opened the door to the room, WOW, was my first thought. Very elegant and modern looking and the view was

The hotel is very poorly maintained and it is very dirty. The outside and lobby look nice but its a whole different story when you get to the room. The room I had still had the last customers soap in it along with the hair left all over. The beds just plain suck and the AC is on a energy saving settings. So if you lay still they will shut off. This hotel ranks as one of the worst I have stayed at.

Summary Heading: Hospitality?! They're in the wrong business.
Summary: When you enter the hotel lobby the decor is such that it leads you to believe that your experience is going to be comparable to the pay. However, once I checked into my room I realized that it was all a facade.   My room, aesthetically, looked a mess! It mirrored the photos uploaded on this website. There were stains on the ceiling & the walls. The patches that were done didn't blend well, so it was nothing short of tacky. Paint was chipped on the wall & was in need of a new paint job.   Also, for the price of the room, I am used to basic amenities: micro-fridge, lotion, 4 face & hand towels (2 were provided). Our party did request a micro-fridge on a Friday, but did not receive it until Saturday night.   During my stay there, my room was never cleaned. Instead of bringing up

I do really like this hotel. I will come back soon. Great place, service, quality, location, good Customer service attention. Also, pretty close from Disneyland, Seal Beach and Long Beach. Overall, great place to stay with family, friends or with you couple.

I booked my reservation through EasyToBook.com, and paid for the reservation. While check-in time at the hotel is 3pm, they didn't have our room ready until 5pm, making us wait for 2 hours! After being in the car all day long with a four year old, this was extremely inconvient. Next they charged my credit card separately for the room, even though all the fees were already paid for. The clerk promised the manager would call us back to discuss, we never recieved a call. I'm pretty sure my four year old daughter can manage this place better. Please do yourself a favor and stay somehwere else.. There's lots of hotel choices in the area, and you deserve  better than this lousy place. We stayed at the Embassy Suites in Garden Grove, which although a little more expensive, was well

Hotel staff are very nice but just about the worst wifi I've encountered in many years. I stay in hotels almost on a weekly basis. The WIFI just keeps going out and not even showing up on my list of available WIFI networks. This happened about every hour for around 30 mins each time over 3 days. Very frustrating when you are trying to work. Entire WIFI needs an upgrade.

Everything was Excellent, Great Customer service. The breakfast bar had a great variety. Very clean and well kept property... Room was clean and very comfortable. Easy access to restaurants and shopping centers, freeways. Major entertainment theme parks.

We stayed for 3 nights at this hotel for our Disneyland trip. I wasn't aware that it was a pet-friendly hotel until a few days before (and one of us isn't particularly pet-friendly :-) so I was worried that our room would bear it out. I requested the front desk clerk if he can put us in a floor that doesn't have a lot of guests with pets. It turns out they try to keep the guests with pets on the lower floors, so he gave us a room on the top floor (#713). The room was very clean and no pet odor at all. The 2 queen beds are comfortable and the pillows, sheets & blankets are satisfactory. There is a desk with 2 chairs, a dresser, a 32" HDTV, but no microwave or mini fridge. The bathroom is small just enough for the shower/tub and toilet. It's french doors do not lock. The sink is

I stayed the Laquinta (orange county-buena park) for just a day, the hotel from the outside is really nice the staff are pleasant. The wi-fi wasn't the best. I was idle for 5 minutes then cuts off every 5-10 minutes then you can get back on again and the business center isnt' that great either, the same issues. slow and you can't print out anything because the file you wanted to open it's blocked so you can't print it out. Overall, the hotel is close to everything.  -Marlyn  Las Vegas

Recently updated, modern, and comfortable hotel; ideal for business travelers. Warm, friendly and professional staff. Wi-Fi, exercise facilities, gratis breakfast, ample parking, and proximity to several restaurants are all distinct advantages. The only disadvantage is access to direct room service. This hotel relies on a remote entity to provide room service and the menu is basic and the food mediocre.

Nice location and rooms were very nice. breakfast was ok and staff very friendly. I would  be happy to stay there again, I have not stayed at many La Quinta hotels, I would recommend this place to everyone.

The parking lot is free with many spots, free wifi and free breakfast. Clean bathrooms and bedrooms. Close to freeways, so you can reach most points in LA area in less than 30-40 min. You can easily reach the Citadel Outlets by car, also. The staff is very friendly and helpful.

We always have a great experience at La Quinta Hotels.  We are so grateful that they welcome our dogs and never charge extra.  It is nice to have breakfast available and the staff is always friendly and helpful.

From the moment we checked in the service was not the best. The person working at the reservation desk was very short with us, we definitely did not feel the love or friendliness. We reserved a non-smoking room however our bathroom stunk of cigarette smoke. Also all of the outlets on two of the room walls did not work. When we informed the front desk about these issues we were rudely told "there's nothing we can do there aren't any other rooms" then the front desk employee immediately stepped away and continued a previous personal conversation with two other employees. A lack of acknowledgement, effort, and apology. Other than the customer service issues the room was fairly clean, the beds were comfortable, and the location was great for our vacation adventures.

very convenient, helpful staff, great laundry facilities, close to great eating places.  The room is laid out in a very well thought-out manner and the beds are very comfortable.  The staff was very helpful in all areas and I just couldn't ask for more.

I stayed for 4 nights at this hotel 1st night amazing HK did everything cleaned our room it was nice when we came back .The next 3 nights were terrible we came back expecting our room to be clean and the beds weren't made no vacuum passed and I had to take the trash out they just put extra towels I let front desk know so they can tell HK for the next morning they said it was going to be taken care of and it wasn't I let front desk know again and nothing . So poor service in housing keeping breakfast was the same the whole stay and front desk wasn't friendly or welcoming at all . A lot to work on it disappointed me worst la Quinta I have stayed at

I left items in my room after check out.  I called as soon as I arrived home and discovered my mistake.  Hotel management investigated and because the left items were neither reported nor turned in to lost and found, I am out of luck! I recommend that management believe their guests!

This hotel was a great stay. The rooms were very well decorated and spacious. We had two rooms with a king bed and a pull out couch. Our room was located right in front of the elevators and we never heard any noises. We had a small fridge and micro in our room as well.   The breakfast had cereals, fruits, hard boiled eggs and make your own waffles. There were plenty of tables in the eating area.   The location of the hotel is right off the freeway but we didn't hear freeway noise. There are a lot of eating locations around the hotel as well.   The only negative thing I found in the hotel was that the towels were not fluffy.   The best thing is that the pool is heated.

Enjoyed our stay here. The staff is very helpful and knowledgeable. It was centrally located and close to restaurants and the places we wanted to go. The area felt safe. The breakfast was good. The rooms clean and well cared for.

For sleep and rest, this is a quiet and clean hotel.  Occasionally, you get some noisy guests, but overall it is quiet.  It is close to freeways, thus it is convenient and easy to access other places, particularly Disney Land, and ...

Summary Heading: La Quinta is the best deal for my money!
Summary: My family and I had decided on an impromtu trip to Disneyland during their 24 hour summer kick off. So we were able to reserve a room online with La Quinta quickly and checked in even faster. Great location with quite a few places to eat within walking distance. The room was perfect for my husband and my two toddlers. The breakfast was extremely crowded due to the Disneyland 24 event I am sure. I love La Quinta its a great value for you what they offer.

Took a chance to stay at the Buena Park location and it was a nice experience.  Plenty of room for all of us.  Good location near the highway, but did not hear any traffic noise.  Breakfast buffet was just your typical waffles, cereal and toast. Would stay again.

Summary Heading: Great Place to stay for any of the attractions
Summary: Great price on a room.  When we arrived the Front Desk Clerk took care of us on all our needs.  Asked where certain restaurants were and he not only told us but printed maps for us. Everything in the room was great including the bed. Large flatscreen TV and the WIFI kept us in touch with family and able to find other locations. The continental breakfast with the waffles and everything else you'd need for breakfast was great!!!

This hotel is in a great location for visitors to Disney Land, Knotts Berry Farm and the eastern parts of LA.  It is very convenient to Interstate 91 and Interstate 5.  It is very busy, and often has large groups of tourists and young people who are coming to perform musical programs at Disney Land.

From the front desk staff to the cleanliness, this is THE place to be! Breakfast is great. All staff is excellent. Rooms are roomy and super clean and comfy. Nice TV and great view. Gym, pool, hot tub, business center, and location are great. Beautiful.

I have found all the staff from the front desk to the house keeping staff have all been wonderful and have gone above standard to always make me feel at home.    Each of the rooms I have stayed in while here on business have been great.

Summary Heading: They love your pets as much as you do
Summary: Perfect place to stay if you have pets. Clean rooms with enough space, friendly staff and helpful - central location. Good value. Free internet. Quiet rooms - easy to sleep after a long day Would stay again, when in the area

Summary Heading: Not too impressed with the inside
Summary: The hotel looks nice for a MOTEL- but was bothered that it did not have the same service or quality at various other LaQuintas in California or other states we have stayed in. The room care was so poor- my allergies acted up the whole time I was in the room. We won't be staying at this particular LaQuinta again!

Positive notes...2 blocks to/from freeway 91.  1 miles away from highway 5.  2 chairs with a table inside the room.  Fridge and microwave $10 additional per night.  Negative notes..bathroom has no lock.  Breakfast has no meat.  Full size bed instead of Queen size bed.

I will keep staying here. It is the home away from home! The first time I stayed at La Quinta Hotel, I was very pleased with the friendliness of staff, the great complimentary breakfast, the comfort of the rooms and also the cleanliness.

Perfect place for kids and my sweet canine. Front desk staff provided excellent customer service. Hotel guests near our room we're arguing and extremely loud. Reported to front desk and situation was handled immediately.

This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel. Since I travel with three dogs to attend dog agility trials, I always look for a local LQ. This hotel is one of the best.  The beds are very comfortable, rooms clean and nice, and there is no hassle ( or extra charge) for my dogs.

The hotel was really quiet, the location great, service is excellent.  All the people working here is very kind including the manager that was so kind to let us store our luggage for some hours before leaving. Only the breakfast could be better or offer more variety like scramble eggs, bacon. But overall I would recommend this hotel.

From the moment we got there,  Lisa the front desk agent,  greeted us in a very friendly manner.  She was such a pleasant person,  while checking us in we shared a couple laughs and she even gave us an upgrade.  The hotel lobby, room and breakfast area were all very clean and beautiful.  This hotel is close to surrounding attractions, the mall, and my kids favorite yogurt shop is right across the street.  Our room was spacious and comfy.  The bright side breakfast includes a waffle maker which was a hit with the kids among the other breakfast foods.  This is our 2nd stay at this hotel and we definitely will be back again. We have 2 children and you can not hear anything from surrounding rooms nor any traffic outside so we all got a great night sleep (which we needed because we

The hotel is not far from the 91 frwy  and is close to Knotts but not jammed packed every time i go ,I love it and its pet friendly thats why we stay its a real warm welome here thank you ,the Rojas's.....

This La Quinta Inn was one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at! The rooms were tiny, the bathroom was the size of a closet. If you wanted to open the door to the room you had to slowly put the key in and hope it worked, you had to try it a dozen times. The elevators got stuck and were very slow. The staff was friendly but very creepy. Overall this hotel has made me choose not to stay at another La Quinta Inn EVER! I have stayed at dozens of hotels and this was one of the worst i ever stayed at.

This was my first time staying in a La Quinta and I hope I never have to again. For just being remodeled the smell was terrible. The lobby looked nice and smelled clean. The 4th floor smells like it has been smoked it and it is gross. That smell also comes into the room. When I went into my room the first thing I noticed was the long hair (not just one but SEVERAL) that were in my "clean" sink in my room. My tub also had hair on the wall which made me less than confident in how well the rest of the room was cleaned. The only good thing I can say is the bed was comfortable. I am not sure how clean the sheets were but I had to not think about that as I needed to get some sleep to be ready for work the next day. This is not some place I would go to on my own accord.

We went to visit family we did not know the area so we just went of the comments, it's a very nice area restaurants just across the street easy accesses to the freeway. The breakfast served was good ,we did not have the breakfast we have a very Particular diet!!! Overall everything is good ,the only thing I wished that it had a kitchen!!!

Very nice rooms.  Good accommodations.  Good value.  Not far from Disneyland and Knotts .  Several good restaurants close by.  Breakfast was included, which was a plus.  Lots of parking and not far from the hotel door so no problem hauling luggage,  The free internet was nice.  I will definitely be back.

Great hotel! This hotel is located in a very convenient location, because it is near several good restaurants.  We had a very clean room.  The staff at this location was very accommodating and detailed all of the amenities of the hotel.  I will definitely stay here again when I am in the area.  Thank you.

I stayed here during a trade show at the Anaheim Convention Center.  It was a few miles up the freeway but easy to get to and from each day.  If the freeway was jammed there are plenty of side streets to get you there in a reasonable time.  The hotel was located conveniently near some good restaurants and they also had a pretty good choice of food in the lobby store.  The rooms were nice and clean and overall the hotel was quiet.  The breakfast was a hot breakfast so I was pleased with that.  What stood out for me was that they did a good job of air filtration inside the hotel.  This hotel is very close to the 91 freeway and the smell of smog outside the hotel will pretty much take your breath away unless you are used to it.  If I am back in the area, I would stay here again.

Summary Heading: Worst La Quinta I have ever stayed at!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Summary: If you don't shower this is the place for you for the showers have no water pressure at all can't get the shampoo out of my hair!!!!!!!!!!!!! The toilets are  like sitting 4 foot off the ground! The people there don't even know there jobs and don't really care! The air conditioner didn't work the floor may have been vacuumed a week ago! Horrible experience to say the least !  Would never never stay here again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Manager Response: Hi Harry, we've read your feedback about your stay at our La Quinta Inn & Suites Orange County - Buena Park.  We're sorry you had such a negative experience while staying with us. Summary: Location was perfect for me right off the freeway. Checkin was flawless and fast. Desk staff was very friendly. Interior was very nice and clean. Room was great, also clean. There are several places to eat close by. Breakfast service was good, lots of choices. Beds were comfy, room quiet enough. Overall a great stay. Used my points for a deal on the room, but list price is still pretty good for the location close to attractions.

Hotel grounds and rooms are well maintained and neat. Lobby is beautifully decorated. Staff friendly and helpful.  Breakfast is varied with waffles, boiled eggs, assorted pastries, yogurt, cold cereals, fruits, bagels, breads, muffins, coffee, tea, and juices.  Location is somewhat isolated with not many restaurants and fast food eateries within walking distance.  However, very quiet facility, so you can rest easily and comfortably.

After 10 minutes someone finally appeared. We went to our room #627 and we discovered the bathroom had urine stains on the toilet and plaster was coming off the wall where the shower rod was connected. One of the room phones was dead and the light over the sink flickered when the switch was on. To top things off the balcony sliding door would not lock at all. We phoned the general manager but have yet to receive a phone call back. This is my favorite place to stay.  We are from that area, and any time we want to visit we go there.  It is a beautiful hotel, the lobby is very impressive, they are friendly, helpful, and MY DOG IS WELCOME WITH NO EXTRA CHARGE.  The suites are large, comfortable, CLEAN, and  beds are comfortable, breakfast is yummy, and there is the best area to walk my dog, safe, with lots of grass and sidewalks.  Hotel is far enough from the Anaheim traffic, but close enough to all the attractions.

Over all the stay ( 4 nights ) wasn't bad. The location to Disneyland was really good and we liked that there were plenty of restaurants nearby the hotel to take advantage of and parking was a breeze.  We travel a lot and you can usually get a sense of a hotel's cleanliness as soon as you step in and out of a elevator. The elevator was not very clean itself and once off on our floor the hallway carpet on our floor was very dirty. It appeared to not have been vacuumed for several days. The breakfast was OK and was kept well stocked. I don't drink juice and wish that this hotel and many others would put out pitchers of water.  We had a king suite and the beds and pillows were as usual LQ comfy. Room size was fairly large though we have been in suites that were much larger. ( we

La Quinta did it again. Very enjoyable stay. I stayed for 3 nights. The room was clean and the beds were comfy. There was a table with a couple of chairs in the room which was convenient. Good amount of space in the room. The staff was very nice. I didn't get any names but keep all the staff if you can! It has very convenient access to the highway without being so close that you hear the traffic.  There was a ton of parking around the hotel due to it being in a business park. The parking was free which seems weird to me to have to even mention but when staying in a hotel in California that isn't always the case. Also, with it being in a business park it felt like the area was safer than other places I've stayed. There are several restaurants within walking distance and a Ralph's

Summary Heading: Very pleased traveler! This hotel had a huge, clean and beautiful room for a great price. Breakfast was great. Staff great, too!
Summary: Our family stayed here from August 8-11. We had a great stay! No complaints @ all. Hot breakfast, parking was always available, clean room, spacious room w/modern tv/bedding/etc. staff was courteous and even though pets were allowed, you'd never know. I was very impressed w/my stay. Hats off to this hotel! The hotel is closer to Disneyland than I thought. It's right off the freeway.chipotle, shakeys pizza, Starbucks, etc. were right there by hotel. Great stay for a great price. Breakfast was oatmeal, cereals, bananas, oranges, booked eggs, yogurt, and waffles. Oj and apple juice.

I booked this room last minute because of a last-minute change otherwise, I probably would not have stayed here. Room REALLY stunk of old musty smoke although it was a nonsmoking room. I'm not sure why they even have smoking rooms in their hotels!!! When I complained of this, the girl said it was a nonsmoking room and didn't know why it smelled like that. Breakfast was dry goods and sugary cereals. The juice was not real juice (tasted like Tang). Although it seemed as though they renovated, their were some signs of "covered up" reno work in the room (i.e. closet door handle/knobs didn't match, closet door was stuck, bad paint work was obvious on wood grain, etc.). I would expect this from a $70/night hotel but not from a $140 hotel. I mentioned this upon checkout. The attendant

We stayed at the La Quinta on the last Saturday of our trip. We moved from the Disneyland Hotel for the final night since we wouldn't be going to the theme parks on Sunday. The price was very good considering the other prices in the same area. This hotel is old, although it has been updated. The shower ceiling showed definite leak repairs and mildew. The bathroom was also tiny. It had a nice pool and we were able to use the washer/dryers on the 2nd floor. The desk clerk "Dave" was very nice and offered to provide transportation to the airport on Sunday morning if necessary (for a fee - which was about $35 less than a cab). VIsiting S. Cal with kids and grand kids.   Main reason was to go to Disneyland.  Good hotel in good location. Everything was clean and staff was friendly.  Nice to have a breakfast available with lots of options.  Stayed five nights.  The only thing I would have changed is to have two queen beds rather than double beds.  That was all that was available when I reserved the rooms.  Not sure if they have queen beds or not.  Slept well anyway even though I'm used to a bigger bed.  Will definitely look into this hotel next time.

We opted to have the cleaners come in each day to give us fresh towels and clean up and make the beds...(nice to come back after a long day out ..to a clean room) The breakfast was just okay!
