I noticed that the pics on this site are very dated. I stayed here last week and BOY, Has It Changed!! The colors are now a modern mix of greys! They have added a Lobby Store AND an Internet Bar!! The rooms are Beautiful! Its been awhile since I' ve been at this La Quinta !!! WOW!! What a TURNOVER ! I usually stay at the Fairfield Inn ! NO MORE! I'm a changed Woman! Staff was friendly and informative! GO La Quinta Buena Park! Keep up whatever it is you are doing! I will definately be back!! ...someone needs to take the NEW PICS of this place! These do NO Justice :)

- had a big and clean room on the 2nd floor - polite employees - the breakfast is moderate - you'll only get plastic dishes - had problems in the bathroom with the sink tree times - the keycard for my room made problems twice times - the area surounding the pool wasn`t cleaned the last few days

Its nice that it is walking distance to many big well known restaurants. The staff was very polite & helpful.  We traveled with small kids so it was nice to have such an incredibly clean room.  It was nice to have a big breakfast to start our day.  It would have been nice if they had highchairs or booster seats though.  Overall it was a great stay.  We plan to stay here again the next time we are in town.

My family and I stayed at this La Quinta Inn while visitng Disneyland and were very pleased with the value for the money.  The room was clean, the beds were very comfortable and the surroundings look like they had been updated.    The only con I have is that the disabled shower which we needed for our daughter could have been designed a little better.  It let water run all down into the bathroom doorway and floor so we ended up with alot of wet socks.    Great place to stay and close to lots of amenities.

Summary Heading: Right place, right price, good times
Summary: This was our second stay at this property. It is quickly becoming our preferred hotel when visiting Buena Park/Knott's Berry Farm. The location is central to most restaurants, shopping and even Knott's Berry farm. Although its off the beaten path from other local hotels/motels, we prefer to be away from the crowds and tourists traps.  Upon arrival we were met with friendly and helpful smiles. Check-in was a breeze and lasted less than 5 minutes. Our room (309) was clean and ready on arrival. The only problem was some remodeling fixtures in the hallway near the elevator. But we were not disturbed or affected by this in any way. The beds we standard doubles, but my family of four was still comfortable. No noises and good sound insulation make for a good nights sleep.  Breakfast

Beautiful hotel at only ten minutes to Disneyland!! Location was perfect 'cause we have all we need so close. Universal Studios Hollywood was at 40 minutes with a little traffic but you know, is Los Angeles! We really enjoy our 10 nights stay!! Thanks!

This was the 2nd LaQuinta that we stayed in on our trip to the LA area.  It was being remodeled and fortunately we had a room that  had already been done.  It was really very big and nice.  The breakfast was very good.  A variety of cold and hot items.  I really like having coffee in the rooms also.

I stayed here in May and absolutely liked the place. It was clean, the rooms were beautiful and the breakfast was good too. Also the location was very convenient. Close to the highway and a lot of restaurants across the street.

Stayed for one night for a work related event. Easy, friendly check in.  Nicely upgraded lounge area. Room was extremely clean, cheerfully bright, and had recently under gone d√©cor renovations.  Beds were comfortable, no outside noise, & in close proximity to a few restaurants as well as local freeway on ramps.  Neighborhood was clean, quiet and seemed to be more of a business zone block (Kaiser Medical Center and a bank bldg. around it).  Breakfast was simple, had the pancake center and yogurt, cereal, toast options. Kind of bummed there wasn't a fruit bowl with apples, oranges, & bananas...but there was enough  other stuff to start the morning.

very clean, quiet, very comfortable beds and pillows, clean sheets, with air condition and over all excellent stay. weekly rate was a plus for the location. well recommended to anybody.  cons: no microwave and refrigerator with the rate that I got.  Thanks, B Colebank, from Virginia

Summary Heading: Great place for a commuting worker
Summary: I've stayed here several times now, 3 and 4 nights at a time. They are still in the process of remodeling but, they seem to be getting closer to being finished. The rooms are now much nicer and more comfortable. For the most part, they are quieter, except for the occasional barking dog or slamming door. Just don't let them stick you close to the elevator. If you stay enough times at La Quinta, you get upgraded to Elite status and get free room upgrades, which, at this hotel, means you get a room with a Microwave and Refrigerator. I do find TV channel selection lacking. Very limited selection.

Love the fact I can travel with my dogs and leave them unattended in the room and leave for a day and do what i need to do! Was sad that there was not a microwave and fridge in the room!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! In General Love Your Hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

This hotel had a better price then the surrounding hotels, and la quintas are always nice. The location is a little far off the beaten path but not too far. Nice comfortable bed, clean room, and good air conditioning. Be forewarned though, lots of little kids running around this hotel.

The staff (very scarce) but when you encounter them, they are accommodating.  I was greeted by a nice young man who helped me with my booking. My room was clean and spacious. I liked that there was free parking and there are a few things nearby. Overall, my experience was great. Will stay again...

Pleasant, close to anything you might need, clean room/linens/lobby/hallways, free breakfast (cold cereal, breads/bagels/muffins, waffles, coffee, yogurt, juice), nice pool, decent  view from the 7th foor, nice staff, comfy bed, good value.   Has room service, I didn't use it though.

Summary Heading: The Perfect Hotel in the Los Angeles area
Summary: We travel with our Greyhounds and we always stay at La Quinta because they treat your pets with the same respect they treat every guest animal or human. The Hotel is very comfortable and the facilities are not only priced well but well maintained and quiet. The los Angeles area is very large and we find that the La Palma location is easy to access from the freeway and close to Knotts Berry Farm and Disneyland. We always stay at La Quinta when we travel because we can be sure to find the hotel clean well managed and accomodating.  Gary & Katrina Davalos

They also have two washers and dryers which is great and they only cost $1.00,  Nothing fancy but it cleans your clothers which is important and you are not breaking the bank.   Front desk staff is friendly and helpful.  For the price it appears to be a good deal. My comapny went really cheap on me.   There is breakfast as mentioned by a previous

If I had been paying for it myself instead of my company paying for it I would have switched hotels--even with it being Spring Break and having to pay more--it was just that bad.  The only reason I gave it a two circle rating instead of one was the front desk staff tried, and I felt they deserved some credit for that. I had a very pleasant stay at this hotel. The staff, housekeeping,and breakfast was wonderful. I would reccamend this hotel to all my family and friends. Even though I didn't use the pool, it was clean and inviting. The hotel had a lot of kids with their parents,but yet it was very quiet.

I take exception to the review that says bright and clean.  this is one of the worst La Quinta's I've stayed at.  I have stayed at many La Quinta's from Missouri to Washington State.  The two worst are this one and one in Coeur d'Alene, ID.   Unfortunately, I stay at this one more frequently now for business (because of the location and price).  I will say the beds are clean, but other than that, the maintenance is terrible.  The corridors smell like cigarette smoke.  The common areas (corridors, stairs, etc.) are dirty.  You can see that any repairs in the rooms or any where else were done by someone that knows very little about maintenance.  I wish someone from Corporate would clean this one up.

Not only was this hotel bright and airy, it was clean and friendly. The rooms were good sized and well-appointed. They take pets, which is why we originally booked our stay here. We were happy to see that they maintain the place and grounds beautifully, and that allowing pets here does not negatively affect the quality of stay in any way.  The pool was nice and clean, and there was space to park our UHaul in the lot. Thanks for a great stay! I would certainly choose to stay here again!

great hotel good safe location plenty of facilities locally great for disney or la, not to far from outlet malls, a small amount of freeway noise church on sunday , freindly reception staff safe parking, can plug your electric car in

Front desk was very personable, only negative was the wall air/heat kept waking me up until I gave in and turned it off.  Great location, easy parking and close to restaurants and the meeting I had to attend

This is a midride hotel vs. the standard 2 story La Quinta, some with exterior facing rooms.  The room is large, modern and clean.  The internet worked well.  The TV was large, flat screen with very good HD channels and reception.  The breakfast was varied and staged in a large area in the lobby with plenty of seating and newspapers.  The hotel location is a block off the 91 Freeway and near many restaurants and attractions.  Parking is plentiful, free and safe.  All in all, a very acceptable alternative to the hotels on Beach Blvd in Buena Park, especially if not visiting the tourist attractions that way.

Entering an age which has always  screamed   retirement   to    me,    I    chose    to    let     my son  influence me.  Since we rarely use  our  annual  passes   at   Disneyland,    I    decided    to    tap into my inner child and enjoy. I was a  bit frustrated   that   I   couldn't   book   closer   to   my    destination,  but  this  location  turned   out   to   be   a   real   gem!    Though   a    bit   noisy    in    the room,  everything  else  was   completely   satisfactory.    They    offered    breakfast    ,which     we forgot to try.  But  the  staff  was   extremely    courteous    and    cheerful.    The    ADA    set-up    was  very  well  planned.  I'm  pleased   that   we   stayed    at    this    location.

Hotel was clean, location was super good, close to restaurants, and freeway, recomended. If you travel for business is good, breakfast is boring but serves the purpuse. High speed internet is fast a reliable. has a business center where you can print your work,fligh pass.etc. Staff is friendly and hotel looks renovated. Pillows for the bed were excellent, tv not much too watch, enought to fall a sleep with. Secure place.

loved this hotel.  friendliest staff ever.  good prices,  comfortable room,  nice breakfast and convienient to where we wanted to go. the manager went above and beyond.  would definitly stay here again and will try other La Quinta's.

We stayed in this hotel for two nights during our vacation with Tours4fun- the distances from LAX airport is about 45 minutes drive in the fast lane.  The hotel is in a isolated spot - it appears very impressive and good to look at - but there are few things that do need improvement - if the room is facing the highway - then forget about the sleep-  the first time around there was only one staff handling the arrivals  - I think she was the only employee at that time of the night - she was very abrupt and rude - could do with some training - the second time around David at the reception was helpful but he too was alone - he was very pleasant and helpful and smiling. I was very pleased with this hotel.  The location is in what I would call a little commercial park, surrounded by companies by day and a few restaurants by night.  (There is a Kinko's conveniently located right across from the hotel, within the park.)  It's close to a few restaurants within walking distance, and a large variety of diversified non-chain restaurants by car (including Thai and Korean!) as well as your typical chain restaurants.  There's a Starbucks right across the street.  The hotel, from the outside and lobby, looked a bit dated.  But the room itself was great!  Clearly renovated recently, as the carpet and bed linens looked brand new.  Plenty of pillows and the bed was comfortable, and a beautiful and large flat screen tv in the room with many channels.  The

Summary Heading: Good for a trip to Knotts Berry Farm
Summary: Stayed here 1 night for our recent trip to Knott's Berry Farm.  Got a good deal from Hotwire.  Overall our stay was good.  I wasn't expecting much from this hotel, but they actually keep the property looking good.  The rooms are not the greatest but for an overnight stay they are perfect, especially if you are going to be out and about all day.  The Beds were nice and comfortable.   The breakfast area is small and gets very crowded.  Not much of a selection, your basic continental items. For what i payed ($55 a night) i would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Knotts.

Stayed here for central area to tourist attractions. 10 mins to Disney, 25 mins to Universal, 1 hr to Legoland. Marie Callendars right across the street, easy off and on highway access.   Stayed on Xmas day and few days after. Hotel was busy with a Japense group staying, so breakfast area was always busy but they kept it well stocked even at busiest times.   Outside area is nice, rooms are all inside. Had a suite room-1 king bed, pullout queen, balcony. Small toliet/tub area. Tub stopper was corroded and rub was slippery. When first turned water on, it appeared to have rust in it, but was fine after ran a few seconds.   Place is fine if you are just  Looking for a reasonable place to sleep and not planning to spend entire time in hotel.   Laundry on 2nd & 4th floor. $1 wash & $1

This hotel is ok if you are looking for a middle of the road place and with no frills or extra's. Very busy when I was there with Disney traffic must have been a very large group staying there for that because at breakfast you could not move or find a place to sit. The view is ok with the palm trees and I did have a upgraded room but still disappointing. Staff was friendly and location is great to the interstate.

Enjoyed four night stay except for the two barking dogs in nearby room.  Tacky, tacky !!   Location is in clean and quiet commercial area very close to highway on-ramp but not close to the noise of it.  Four good mid-priced restaurants within easy walking distance.   Very safe area only a few miles from major attractions.

We have stayed here before, and stay at LQs often. The outside was littered with cigarettes and trash, cans and receptacles were overflowing.  It was the same in the morning. Breakfast service was overcrowded, understaffed, and messy.   I totally understand having a full-house, but it's on management to staff up to manage it. My family and I had to pass on the overcrowded morning service and even coffee and juices were gone. I tried to find help for the non-english speaking guests and ourselves, only to come up empty... Everyone seemed on edge in the hotel.   We have stayed here before and enjoyed it. Based on our recent stay, I doubt we'll be back to this one.

Check-in was fast and easy! Front desk person was very nice and helpful. Lobby area was clean and tidy, I felt comfortable. Rooms were nice and clean for the price and everything worked as intended (AC, TV, etc etc..)  Got a very good nights sleep, woke up refreshed!  I will definitely stay here again next time I'm in town!

Summary Heading: Great room for family with young children
Summary: This hotel is in an excellent location (once you find it behind the main street  on Centerpointe!)  It had plenty of parking.  Good value, hot waffle breakfast and good variety of other items i.e. yogurt, milk, cereal, oranges, apples, juice, coffee, etc.  Could have used a filtered water dispenser but otherwise was a great spread of food.  Get down to breakfast a bit earlier than you need to leave because tour groups were and can be plentiful for this hotel.  Also, we had a fifth floor room so the elevator gets a bit backed up with all the tour groups coming and going.  Room was clean, up-to-date--I felt good about my toddler being on the floor there.  One drawback is that the bathroom doors don't lock (only a problem if you have a toddler you are trying to keep out :))  We

My initial reason for staying at La Quinta, Buena Park was for business.  When I found out I had to stay the weekend I flew my wife out from Wisconsin.  We went to Disneyland and California Adventure ending our trip with a stay about the Queen Mary in Longbeach.  This hotel is excellent, excellent, excellent, Clean, Friendly, and Delicious Breakfast.  Conveniently located 15 min from Disney and about 30 from Long Beach.  The only suggestion I have is to please post the pool hours.  Otherwise, I would recommend this to any business traveller, couple, or family looking for an affordable place to stay.

Stay 6 nites in Sept 2012. clean, comfortable rooms. Hotel is in a quiet area. its off the 91 between the 605 and the 5. Very good breakfast, Pet friendly, good parking, helpful & friendly staff, all for $70 a nite . Had a great stay at the L Q La Palma property

This hotel was great but a long way from town & only a few restaurants nearby so not good for someone without transport as very expensive to get a taxi to major attractions. It is however a very good hotel with excellent staff who work very hard to make your stay enjoyable & very good buffet breakfast was included in the price. The hotel was very clean too , would go again if transport was available.

Summary Heading: Great value and close to Disney
Summary: Staff very friendly and helpful.  We wanted two connecting rooms, spoke to front desk the day before arrival and they were blocked out and ready when we arrived.  Room is very clean, nice size and comfortable with good flat screen.  The standard king bed room comes with mini fridge and microwave.  The included breakfast was fresh and ample.  There are many stores and restaurants in the area, and travel to Disney only took 15 min.  Great for a hotel under $100.00.  We will definitely stay here again!

I thought that the staff was friendly and very helpful to me and my family. It was one of the cleaniest hotels I've stayed in. At night, it was easy to fall asleep in the quiet, comfortable rooms. The breakfast area was clean and easy to get to and the location of the hotel was easy to find and get to other places because they were all in that general area.

Summary Heading: Best Place to Stay in Long Beach/Orange County Area
Summary: I love love this place. Best customer service. Best staff. The location is perfect...Disneland, Knotts Berry Farm, Medieval Time and Buena Park mall are 20 minutes away. The rooms are always very clean and kept. The outside area has sufficient amount of grass for my pets. Nice size pool and always clean. Restaurants within walking distance. This is a home away from home for me and my husband, as well as my extended family...even though we only live 30 minutes away. When our family from out of town come to visit, this is the only place we want them to stay. The staff is extremely helpful and very friendly...wonderful customer service hands down.

They want our business. Good strategic location for LA Basin plus Orange County. Clean nice room under $100 with a flatscreen TV and free breakfast. I do that deal all day long in LA if I am price sensitive.....which I am.

Spent 3 nights with my family June 2012 and while the decor and such seem dated, everything was very clean.  Housekeeping service was very good, room was quiet and beds comfy.  Elevators could be slow, and they served some weird OJ that was reminiscent of "Tang", the old powdered drink, nor was the coffee worthwhile but the rest of the breakfast fare was as expected and just fine.  The location is just off the 91 Freeway, but in a quite business neighborhood with a couple of restaurants within walking distance.  Would be nice to have a microwave and fridge.
Very nice accommodations for the price with friendly, helpful staff.  Location was out of the way but near freeways and restaurants.

We arrived late at night and were given our room key right away.  The hotel was completely sold out.  We had a great room on the 3rd floor.  It looked very nice, great beds, nice bathroom.  Only thing missing was a fridge.  Breakfast in teh morning had waffles, hard boiled eggs, oatmeal, yogurt, juice and coffee, muffins, bagles, ceral and milk.  It was plenty for our family of 4 (including some picky kids).  There was plenty of seating, but we took our food upstairs to our room and hung out before we left for the day.  Check out was easy.  I would absolutely recommend.

This hotel had a friendly staff, it was very nice (a little hidden and off the beaten path), but we only stayed for the night so that I could attend my 40-year high school reunion (which was held in the near by city of Long Beach, CA.).  The only problem that I saw while we were there is the "amount" of dogs (more than 6) that were on site.  Some of the little ones were okay but one man had a "pit bull" that was a little scary. But other than that it was a good stay and I would recommend it to anyone. The Hall's (from San Diego, CA.)

Summary Heading: NOT CLOSE TO LAX BUT WONDERFUL WONDERFUL HOTEL
Summary: If you are thinking about this hotel.....DO IT! This hotel is great! Stay here. The staff were great, room was clean, waffles in the morning were great, and last minute they upgraded my room. All my friends and activites were in LA. so that made it a little hardd because I was about 18-25 miles away depending on where in LA I was going, but I am use to driving long distances to get home so 25 miles wasnt bad for me. But if you dont like being in traffic or driving this hotel may not be a good fit.  But what I can say.....is it is WORTH IT have a good safe hotel.

We will stay here again! A nice hotel with pool...good service and location close to Disney, Knotts Berry farm, and took us only 20 minutes to get to Universal Studios. Great location for families going to any of the three parks and great if you are going to more then one.
Clean hotel, staff was very accomodating.  Easy access to the hotel.  Ample parking.  Convenient to most places I needed to go.

We recently stayed at the Buena Park location which was near LAX and Disneyworld Resort. I chose this location because it was close to where we wanted to go. Easy check-in late and was able to reserve an additional night when I checked in. The front desk was always friendly and so was the help. The room was very comfortable and homey. We like the fact that they are one of a few pet friendly hotels that is comfortable and very clean. We will be traveling for two weeks soon and plan on staying at the LQ hotels along the way.   I would definately recommend this chain for business or pleasure.  DK

We stayed here for 2 nights visiting family and vacationing. It's been our home away from home for several times. We like the fact that it's in a business area so it wouldn't be noisy. Check-in was a breeze and the staff was very polite and welcoming. We asked for quiet room and was given a room on the 5th floor. The room had everything we needed except for fridge & microwave which weren't included in the price. Bathroom was clean and towels were good enough. Again, just like our previous stay, we had two quiet and restful nights sleeping. Breakfast was enough for us with juices, bread, muffins, hard boiled eggs, fruits, make your own waffles, cereals, instant oatmeal, tea & coffee.  Breakfast was served from 6-9 on weekdays. However, this time I saw the breakfast attendant

Summary Heading: Good value for money in great location
Summary: We had a great stay at the La Palma property while visiting relatives.  The location is very good, with convenient access to highways and main roads, restaurants of all descriptions close by and shopping, gas etc.  The front desk staff were helpful and attentive, the breakfast area was kept spotless even though it was quite busy after 8am (go earlier if you can).  The rooms were clean and well-maintained and offered perfectly adequate space, comfortable beds and updated TV.

La Quinta Buena provided a great location and good value for some necessary down time. Easy walking distance to several decent resturaunts, shopping malls and freeway close to most local attractions. We hope to visit again real soon.

We stayed for a week  as we are house searching in the area. At this Inn we had a great time.The people are so friendly and the breakfasts are wonderful. It allowed our dog and this was a great help. Our rooms were perfect for what we needed. Granted it was priced rather high and the only reason we checked out because we could stay for half the price at the Inn in San Bernadino which is where we returned to until we get into our new home. I highly reccommend it outside of the price.

Just finished a 3 night stay at the this hotel. Hotel is located on the edge of La Palma in the business park. Just a block east and you enter the city of Buena Park. This hotel is popular for schools, tour groups and families as evident during the breakfast hours. Outside of the hotel looks normal with 7 floors while inside hotel hallways, it looks dated. Check-In was quick and easy. Two elevators available but its really slow in the breakfast hours. I was booked into the dreaded 7th floor and upon exiting the elevator, I see the outdated red carpeted hallway and outdated crown mouldings around the door. Once I entered my room, I was greeted by a musty urine smell. Yuck! I found also two double beds, not queen beds. Too small for my liking. Outdated decor as well and styling as

The male front desk agent was friendly and helpful.  However, the rooms left a lot to be desired.  Upon entering our room (on the 7th floor), we noticed a terrible musty/moldy odor... almost like a sour wet smell.  We returned to the desk, and were reassigned to a room on the 2nd floor.  The room had the same odor (but to a lesser extent.)  The furnishings in the room were worn, run-down and just plain dirty.  We could not even sit on the sofa because it was so soiled/stained.  I used almost a full can of air freshener in hopes of masking the smell, to no avail.  The cramped, tiny bathroom was a joke.  The complimentary "breakfast" was mediocre and overcrowded.  The positives?  Good TV, free WIFI and refrigerator/microwave in the room.

I have stayed at this Hotel on several occasions. The staff has always gone above and beyond for me each time. The housekeeping staff is awesome! All areas of the Hotel are very clean. It is located in a quiet area with a ton of different restaurants within 1 block of hotel! Ranging from higher end Italian all the way down to Jack in the box. The breakfast is ALWAYS a +. This Hotel even has windows that open at least 6 inches! Shopping is less than 2 miles! Knotts Berry Farm less than 3 mi. away! Disneyland, less than 8 miles away! If you book at least 2 weeks out, you will find a SUPER deal! (Thats what I always do (o:) If you're traveling on business or Liesure...I would highly recommend this Hotel. GREAT PLACE! GREAT STAFF!! GREAT RATES!!!  THANKS TO THE WONDERFUL STAFF AT LA

Summary Heading: decent , better than average , laziest maids ever :(
Summary: check was fast and easy ( see my comment at end ) and the room was clean and fairly modern , hall ways are a bit run down.  they have a computer room 1x pc and printer , a decent exercise room and pool with hot tub , plenty of parking .  the biggest let down for this hotel is the maid staff , our room had the minimum done each day ,no new soaps or shampoos , one day we requested the was made up early as we wanted to sleep , the receptionist did so while we at the desk but housekeeping left us till 4:30 :(   , we also found the breakfast room staff to be more intrested in using thier cell phones and making thier own snacks than refilling the breakfast items.  breakfast was pretty poor basic selection .  *they seem to take in bus fulls of asian tourists , check in was VERY busy

This was our 2nd visit to this hotel in 3 months. Just like the first visit, everything was great. We arrived on Sunday afternoon and the parking lot was quite empty. The gentleman at the front desk was the same person who attended to us when we visited back in March. Sorry I didn't get his name but he was wonderful. We asked for a quiet room and we got one on the 7th floor (top) just like last time. The room was clean and got everything we needed. However, in the evening we could hear everything our neighbor was saying, included their dog barkng. We realized that there was connecting door in our room. So my husband went downstairs to see if we could change to a different room. Yep...the gentleman was so professional and gave us a different room without any problem. We slept

We stayed here for one night because the other La Qunita in Hawaiian Gardens was sold out and preferred that one near LAX. As all La Quinta, breakfast was complimentary and included many items. Also, the hotel is little bit outdated as you'll notice but nonetheless it is a very nice business area and near by Knott's Berry Farm and Anaheim Disney area. It's near Buena Park area and close to I-605 freeway.  There is a shopping center near by I believe Cerritos Shopping Center with major brands.  The hotel is in close proximity to a handful of fast food restaurants. Wifi is also free.

This is a typical La Quinta, but it takes pets, and so here we are.  The cat likes it.  Nice staff.  Clean.  Next to the Flame Broiler and several other good places to eat.  Easy freeway access.    Lot of tour buses there.  Very busy breakfast.  But they are all gone by 9 AM and then it is quiet.

We stayed for a couple of days and we reserved a non smoking room they gave us one. As we approached the lobby it smelled like cigarettes. Not only did the lobby smell it seemed the entire 4th floor smelled like smoke. Our room was on the non smoking side but every time we opened the door it seemed the smell would travel into our room. It was a great stay and the only complaint was the smell. Great location and great price not sure if I would stay again

We started staying at this La Quinta when my now 22-year daughter started playing club volleyball at age 14, and her team stayed there.   It's not the Ritz or Four Seasons, but it meets our needs and we keep coming for our youngest daughter's volleyball tournaments (we stay there about 6 times a year from January to June).  The rooms are clean and comfortable, and the hotel provides free internet.  Location is central for all Southern California Volleyball Association (SCVA) tournaments, and close to Knotts Berry Farm and Disneyland.  Nearby restaurants (meaning within walking distance) are Marie Calendars, a sports-theme, Mexican, Panda Express and Sushi, to name a few.   The breakfasts are very simple, i.e. coffee, juice, cereal, yogurt, bagels/bread, some fruits, and
We were pleasantly surprised with the wonderful breakfast offered, really exceeded our expectations.  The room was very clean and customer service was great!

Summary Heading: We gave it one more chance.  It will probably be the last.
Summary: It's been one year since our last visit.  Sadly, things have not improved and we will not be staying here again.  PROS:  LOCATION:  As I said in my last review, we love the location.  That hasn't changed.  ROOM DESIGN:  It is large and clean, so props for that.    CONS:  SMELL:  Though this place is billed as non-smoking, as with our last stay, there was a strong odor of cigarette smoke, this time upon exiting the elevator on our floor (fourth).  Unfortunately, our room was close by, so the smell got into our room a bit.  There was also another odor in our room that made me want to sneeze.   STAFF:  Hit or miss.  The person who checked us in was just fine.  The person who checked us out was not (see below).   BUSINESS CENTER:  Unbelievably, the printer, which didn't work last

The room was clean and comfortable.  Beds and pillows were soft, breakfast was delicious and the staff were friendly and accomadating.  I would stay her again, for sure.  Not walking distance to resaurants or shopping, close to freeway on ramps.  Good place to come "home" to after a busy day at Disneyland.  Nice and quiet.
Had nice clean rooms. The staff was willing to help with all our needs and wants.  Nice pool, overall great experience

Summary Heading: An old favorite wasn't up to par this time
Summary: We've stayed here numerous times because of it's location.  This time however, we were saddened to find that it had slipped in several ways.  PROS:  LOCATION:  We like this place because it's very convenient for us to visit family in this area, as well as the numerous theme parks.  Yet it's just off the usual crowded hotel areas like Beach Blvd, so the traffic and "busyness" isn't as bad.  ROOM:  Good size for this type of motel/hotel type property.  Ours was a King/fridge/microwave room with a love seat and very comfortable office type chair and large desk.  We've had recliners in our rooms before, but this office chair was just fine.  As always, the room was clean and functional.  Good water pressure and lighting.  The windows can slide open if you want to air out the room.

the hotel was great. my first time visiting california and this hotel was recomended by  my travel  agent. I enjoyed my stay there the staff was very helpful with information of thr surrounding areas.

We found this hotel at the last minute. Upon arrival check-in was brisk, and not hassled at all. The room itself was very clean, and smelled good. If this is a pet friendly hotel, then I found no sign of it at all. The hallways and elevation where also clean and in workable condition.   The pool area and grounds looked good, though the pool was a bit cool for my taste. Considering the close proximity to Knott's Berry Farm, the property was not too busy at all. Tis despite the fact that it is on a main drag of the city, and many national businesses nearby.   The only downsides were that there are only a few restaurant choices nearby.
